thread.title: DIARY-Top Economic Events to Oct 15
thread.title_full: DIARY-Top Economic Events to Oct 15 | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: DIARY-Top Economic Events to Oct 15
text:
Oct 3 (Reuters) -
For other diaries, please see:
U.S. Federal Reserve
Polling unit diary
Today in Washington
Political and general news
Index of all diaries
Major central bank events
** This Diary is filed daily ** SATURDAY, OCTOBER 3 BOSTON - Federal Reserve Bank of New York President William Dudley discusses "Is the Active Use of Macroprudential Tools Institutionally Realistic?" before the "Macroprudential Monetary Policy" conference hosted by the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston in Boston - 1500 GMT. SUNDAY, OCTOBER 4 LONDON - FT Africa Summit 2015 (to Oct. 5). Central bank of Nigeria Governor Godwin Emefiele will be speaking at the summit.
MONDAY, OCTOBER 5 LUXEMBOURG - Eurogroup meeting in Luxembourg. TUESDAY, OCTOBER 6 LIMA - International Monetary Fund holds press briefing on the World Economic Outlook - 1400 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Ensuring Inclusive Development: Good Practices in Promoting Accountability in Latin America" - 1700 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Labor Market's Impact from the Slowdown in Latin America" - 1900 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank holds Youth Dialogue - 2030 GMT. LIMA - World Bank holds a discussion on Social Inclusion: WikiStage and World Bank Group Lima Special Event - 2200 GMT. Speakers:- World Bank President Jim Yong Kim and World Bank Managing Director Sri Mulyani Indrawati. SAN FRANCISCO - Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President John Williams speaks on the economic outlook before the Urban Land Institute Fall Meeting - 2130 GMT. LUXEMBOURG - Meeting of Economic and Financial Affairs Council (ECOFIN). SYDNEY - Reserve Bank of Australia holds interest rate meeting - 0330 GMT. TOKYO - Bank of Japan holds monetary policy meeting (to Oct. 7). WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 7 LIMA - The International Monetary Fund holds a press briefing on Global Financial Stability Report - 1400 GMT. LIMA - The IMF holds a discussion on "Capacity Development in Latin America and the Caribbean and the Way Forward" - 1430 GMT. Speakers: IMF Deputy Managing Director Carla Grasso and Central Bank of Jamaica Governor Brian Wynter. LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on "Flagship: Inequality, Opportunity and Prosperity" - 1500 GMT. LIMA - The IMF holds a press briefing on Fiscal Monitor- 1530 GMT. LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on Ideas for Action: Youth Engagement for Financing the Future of Development - 1600 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund holds a discussion on "Bridging the Pacific: Harnessing the Benefits of Rising Trade and Financial Integration Between Asia and Latin America" - 1630 GMT. Speakers:- IMF First Deputy Managing Director David Lipton and People Bank of China Deputy Governor Yi Gang. LIMA - World Bank holds a discussion on "Building on Peru's Success: Boosting Productivity for Faster Growth" - 1715 GMT. Speakers: World Bank President Jin Yong Kim, Peru Finance Minister Alonso Segura and Polish Finance Minister Mateusz Szczurek. LIMA - International Monetary Fund holds a Conversation on Climate Change - 1900 GMT. Speakers: IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde and World Bank President Jim Yong Kim. LIMA - International Monetary Fund holds a discussion "Energy Pricing-Getting it Right" - 2030 GMT. Speakers: IMF Deputy Managing Director Min Zhu and former Irish President Mary Robinson. LIMA - International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde and World Bank President Jim Yong Kim participates in a Town hall meeting - 2230 GMT. LONDON - Bank of England holds Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting (to Oct. 8). TOKYO - Bank of Japan announces rate decision - 0200 GMT. FRANKFURT - European Central Bank Governing Council meeting. No interest rate announcements scheduled. COPENHAGEN - Danish Economic Councils will publish the bi-annual report with forecasts of the Danish economy - 1000 GMT.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 8
LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on "Financial Inclusion: Can It Meet Multiple Macroeconomic Goals?" - 1500 GMT. Speakers:- IMF Deputy Managing Director Min Zhu and Reserve Bank of India Governor Raghuram Rajan. LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on "Fragility in Middle Income Countries: New Ideas for Unique Challenges" - 1500 GMT. LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on "Infrastructure: Investing for Growth, Investing for People" - 1530 GMT. Speakers:- World Bank Chief Financial Officer Bertrand Badre, World Bank Managing Director Sri Mulyani Indrawati and Ivory Coast Finance Minister Niale Kaba. LIMA - IMF/World Bank discussion on "Latin America in the Spotlight: New Challenges for Central Banking in Latin America" - 1645 GMT. Speakers:- Bank of England Deputy Governor Nemat Shafik, Central Bank of Brazil Governor Alexandre Tombini, Central Bank of Peru Governor Julio Velarde and Central Bank of Chile President Rodrigo Vergara. LIMA - International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney and Brazilian Finance Minister Joaquim Levy participate in discussion on the global economy - 1800 GMT. LIMA - World Bank President Jim Yong Kim holds news conference - 1500 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Solutions for the Solutions Bank?" - 1800 GMT. LIMA - World Bank President Jim Yong Kim participates in a discussion titled "Young Entrepreneurs as Drivers of Sustainable Growth" - 1900 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Growth and Inclusion in Latin America: the Next Decade" - 1930 GMT. Speakers:- IMF Deputy Managing Director Mitsuhiro Furusawa, Central Bank Peru former Governor Richard Webb and Peru Finance Minister Alonso Segura. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "The Financial System We Want: Reshaping Finance for Sustainable Development" - 2000 GMT. Speakers:- Bank of England Governor Mark Carney, Central Bank of Bangladesh Governor Atiur Rahman, People's Bank of China Deputy Governor Yi Gang and Central Bank of Brazil Governor Alexandre Tombini - 2000 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Mobilizing Financing for Private Investment - 2100 GMT. LIMA - World Bank President Jim Yong Kim participates in discussion on "Future of Food: A Conversation about Shaping a Climate-Smart Food System" - 2130 GMT. LIMA - G-24 members hold news conference - 2230 GMT. MANKATO, United States - Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Narayana Kocherlakota gives welcome remarks and participates in forum before the Greater Mankato Growth Event - 1700 GMT. WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Open Market Committee will publish the minutes of September policy meeting - 1800 GMT. SPOKANE, United States - Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President John Williams speaks on the economic outlook before the Spokane Metropolitan Area Business and Community Leaders Luncheon - 1930 GMT. LONDON - Bank of England announces interest rate decision - 1100 GMT. LONDON - Bank of England will publish the minutes of interest rate meeting - 1100 GMT. ST LOUIS - Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard gives welcome remarks before the Children's Saving Account Symposium hosted by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis - 1330 GMT.
FRIDAY, OCTOBER 9
LIMA - G-20 members hold news conference - 1330 GMT. LIMA - World Bank holds a discussion on "Unleashing Private Investment in Renewable Energy" - 1600 GMT. Speakers:- World Bank President Jim Yong Kim and Norway Foreign Minister Borge Brende. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Combating Illicit Financial Flows: Turning Commitments into Action" - 1600 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund Middle East and Central Asia department holds news conference - 1615 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Structural Reforms, Inequality, and Growth" - 1630 GMT. Speakers:- IMF Deputy Managing Director Min Zhu, Mexico Finance Minister Luis Videgaray, South African Finance Minister Nhlanhla Nene and Eurogroup President Jeroen Dijsselbloem. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Managing the Volatility of Commodity Revenues: Fiscal Policy Responses" - 1730 GMT. Speakers:- IMF Deputy Managing Director Mitsuhiro Furusawa, Chile Finance Minister Rodrigo Valdes and Angola Finance Minister Armando Manuel. LIMA - IMF Asia and Pacific Department holds a news conference - 1815 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Balancing Sustainable Growth and Social Equity: Lessons from Latin America and East Asia" - 1900 GMT. Speakers:- World Bank Chief Operating Officer Sri Mulyani Indrawati and Philippines Finance Secretary Cesar Purisima. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Quality Education for Equitable Growth". Serbia Finance Minister Dusan Vujovic will be speaking - 1930 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary and Financial Committee members hold a news conference - 2200 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Today to 2030" - 2230 GMT. Speakers:- World Bank President Jim Yong Kim, IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde and UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon. MILWAUKEE, United States - Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans speaks on current economic conditions and monetary policy before the CFA Society Milwaukee "Economics and Monetary Policy Update" - 1730 GMT. NEW YORK - Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Dennis Lockhart speaks before the Society of American Business Editors and Writers (SABEW) Fall Conference - 1310 GMT. VIENNA - National Bank of Austria chief Ewald Nowotny speaks at a business journalists event - 0800 GMT.
SATURDAY, OCTOBER 10
LIMA - Bank of Canada Governor Stephen Poloz will give a speech at the Institute of International Finance - 0645 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "What Makes a 'Sustainable City'?" - 1530 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Ready for Takeoff: Implementing the Post-2015 Agenda". IMF Deputy Managing Director Min Zhu will be speaking - 1645 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank discussion on "Talking Taxes: Working with Developing Countries to Build the Global Agenda" - 1700 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank Forum on "Revisiting Monetary Policy Frameworks". IMF First Deputy Managing Director David Lipton will deliver opening remarks - 1900 GMT. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank Forum - Session 1 - Monetary Policy and Financial Stability - 1900 GMT. Speakers:- Central Bank of Brazil Governor Alexandre Tombini, Bank of England Deputy Governor Nemat Shafik and ECB board member Benoit Coeure. LIMA - International Monetary Fund/World Bank Forum - Session 2 - Monetary Policy Frameworks in Low Income and Developing Countries - 1900 GMT. Speakers:- Central Bank of Paraguay Governor Carlos Fernandez Valdovinos, Central Bank of Botswana Governor Linah Mohohlo and Bank of Ghana Governor Kofi Wampah.
ZAGREB - Speech by Bank of Finland Governor Erkki Liikanen.
MONDAY, OCTOBER 12
WASHINGTON - Bank of Canada Governor Stephen Poloz is scheduled to make a luncheon speech at the National Association for Business Economics. ORLANDO, United States - Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Dennis Lockhart speaks before the AUBER Fall Conference - 1210 GMT CHICAGO - Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans speaks on current economic conditions and monetary policy before the World Steel Association 49th Annual Conference - 1430 GMT. SYDNEY - Reserve Bank of Australia Deputy Governor Philip Lowe speaks at the CFA Institute Australia Investment Conference - 2145 GMT.
TUESDAY, OCTOBER 13 WASHINGTON - Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard speaks on the U.S. economy and monetary policy before the National Association for Business Economics 57th annual meeting, "North America's Place in a Changing World Economy" - 1200 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 14
WASHINGTON - Federal Reserve issues the Beige Book of economic condition - 1800 GMT.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 15
ST LOUIS - Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard gives opening remarks before the 40th Annual Fall Policy Conference hosted by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis - 1430 GMT.
